definition[0]: to do something to help a process or activity start or develop more quickly
example[0]: He urged further interest rate cuts in a bid to kick-start the economy.
definition[1]: to start a motorcycle using your foot
definition[2]: the part of a motorcycle that you press with your foot to start it
definition[3]: action taken to make a plan, project etc start or develop more quickly
example[1]: Motivation is the kick-start you need to succeed at work.
definition[4]: to do something to make a process or activity develop more quickly
example[2]: Augustâ€™s cut in interest rates helped kick-start the housing market.
